name: Breast
description: The mammary gland is a modified apocrine sweat gland composed of 15-20 lobes of tubuloalveolar glands embedded in adipose and connective tissue. Its structure varies with age, menstrual cycle, and pregnancy.

features: Lobes of tubuloalveolar glands separated by interlobar connective tissue
Two types of epithelium: luminal secretory and basal myoepithelial cells
Intralobular stroma: loose, hormone-responsive connective tissue
Interlobular stroma: dense fibrous connective tissue with adipose
location: Anterior chest wall overlying pectoralis major
Extends from 2nd to 6th rib, sternum to midaxillary line
Axillary tail of Spence extends toward axilla
function: Milk production and secretion during lactation
Myoepithelial cells contract to expel milk
theory.examTips: Breast lymphatic drainage: 75% to axillary nodes (most important for cancer spread). Remember the two cell layers: inner luminal cells (secretory) and outer myoepithelial cells (contractile, tumor suppressors). Cooper's ligaments provide structural support.
